session.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a period of time used for a particular activity, especially by a group of people
session.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: a training session for teachers about computers
session.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament
session.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the first televised session of parliament
The court is now in session.
Board members met in closed session  (=with nobody else present).
session.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a part of the year when classes are given at a college or university
session.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Every training session starts with a series of exercises.
He crashed during a practice session before this Sunday's Belgian Grand Prix.
His talk was followed by a question and answer session.
I normally have two or three photo sessions a week.
At one point his parents joined him for a family therapy session.
I think we should just get together and have a brainstorming session.
We had a special training session yesterday.
We're doing a photo session tomorrow.
Some doctors require patients to attend counselling sessions.
session.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a period of time, usually a day, when buying and selling takes place on the stockmarket
session.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The Euro slid sharply in the European trading session.
Stock prices sank for the fourth consecutive session.
session.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a meeting used by a group of people for a particular purpose
session.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: After theopening session we run a series of workshops.
Thereâ€™s no substitute for thorough preparation before a negotiation session with the client.
session.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a court or a parliament
session.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Morocco and Tunisia are host to the next two sessions of the trade talks.
The European parliament is in session in Strasbourg.
